orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem that coordinates trucks and hoists to achieve the global stacking goals while minimizing total time.

public_information: Trucks can drive between places; travel time depends on each truck's speed and distances.
Hoists manipulate crates at places; load/unload durations depend on crate weight and hoist power.
Crates can be stacked on pallets or other crates; crates are both movable objects and surfaces.
Distances are directed and given between all places.
Initial stacks and object placements are provided in init.

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert in encoding multi-agent temporal planning problems into PDDL with numeric fluents and durative actions. You will be given the environment initial state and goals and the private constraints of trucks and hoists. Produce a PDDL domain and problem that models trucks driving (with durations based on distance and truck speed), hoists lifting/putting/loading/unloading (with durations and temporal qualifiers), the clearance and stacking constraints, and the numeric fluents for time, distances, speeds, weights, and powers. Ensure actions are attributed to the correct agent types (truck vs hoist). Output the domain enclosed in <domain></domain> tags and the problem enclosed in <problem></problem> tags. Do not include anything else.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The trucks' constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->truck2->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->truck3->private_information}.
The hoists' constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist3->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist4->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist5->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist6->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist7->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent and the given initial state. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
